definitions.definition: The part of the bow containing the hawseholes.
The horizontal distance or area between an anchored vessel's bows and the actual position of her anchor(s).
(of a vessel) To lie uneasily to an anchor, typically due to a weather tide.
In a position relative to the course and position of a vessel, somewhat forward of the stem.
(of a vessel) Lying to two anchors, streamed from either bow.
